column1: Art Institute of Chicago////How have I not been here before? The Art Institute is a must see when in Chicago. I originally came to check out the Hokusai print exhibit (closing tomorrow) but was immediately distracted by the vast array of other art collections-- you are bound to find something you've never seen or heard of before. Case in point-- I discovered a wonderful collection of miniature rooms (smaller than dollhouse size) decorated in the style of different regions and time periods. Who would have thought? Yes
column2: you will see classic pieces here
column3: but sometimes you may find an artwork you're never seen before that resonates with you.
